['Page 7:
[¬s]"The procedure of the experiment is presented in Fig. 5. The total length of the experiment was 90 min. Participants ﬁrst took a 15-min
pretest, and then received a 10-min instruction on the upcoming procedure and the operation ofthe smartphone. All participants were then
randomly assigned into one ofthe four experimental groups, and were given a smartphone, and a copy ofthe print reading material relevant
to their group assignment. During the next 50 min, participants read the two articles in the print material. When they ﬁnished reading an
article, a comprehension test (i.e., the posttest) was given. After ﬁnished reading both articles and completing the associated comprehension
tests, the participants took a 15-min survey on their learning experience with the new system.[¬e]"']
int_leng_info: 90 minutes total, 50 minutes for intervention 15 minutes each for pre-test and post-test, and 10 minute informative discussion about the procedure.

1. WEEKLY MEASUREMENT OF STUDENTS = 1 - 5 minutes  'At grades 2-5, respectively, students had 1,5,2,3 and 5 min to complete the test.' (p.521). 2. STUDENT FEEDBACK = 2 x 20 minute sessions across the intervention  'Teachers taught students to read and interpret graphs and skills profiles in two 20-min sessions...teachers also taught students to ask themselves questions about their graphs and skills profiles...' (p.521) 3. CWPT = 4 x 30 minute sessions to teach CWPT (p.524) & 8 - 13 mins of peer learning  'Each CWPT session was divided into 5 - 8 min of coaching and 3 - 5 min of practice.' (p.525)
